titles.title: Recognizing the importance of the Border Patrol in combating human smuggling and commending the Department of Justice for increasing the rate of human smuggler prosecutions.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Citizenship, Refugees, Border Security, and International Law.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Immigration, Citizenship, Refugees, Border Security, and International Law

bill.summary:
1/6/2009--Introduced.
Reaffirms support for the Border Patrol's importance in combating human smuggling. Commends the Department of Justice (DOJ) for increasing the rate of human smuggler prosecutions.
